message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.DB 

This paper deals with improving the performance of collaborative filtering algorithms by incorporating textual data describing item properties. This falls under the domain of information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of latent Dirichlet allocation (LDA) for topic modelling is a common technique in natural language processing (cs.CL) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper also deals with similarity measures and sparsity problems, which are relevant topics in database systems (cs.DB).
